title.narrative: Le complexe socioculturel Sidi Ali Azouz

description.narrative: The association aims to provide adapted services in a housing facility for the women living in the street, mainly victims of domestic violence in order to minimize their exposure to further violence, exclusion and marginalization. Oxfam support in 2013 aims to allow the association to open a temporary housing facility as the permanent housing facility is under construction. Meanwhile, Beity has designed a trajectory of the services provided and has ensured that human resources are recruited and trained. It also includes an important advocacy component on violence against women, such as on the elaboration of a blueprint law on violence against women. In 2014/2015, Oxfam continue supporting the temporary housing facility and the advocacy efforts for ending violence against women During 2016 the association wants to open a new house for women and do some income generation activites

participating-org.narrative: The associatoin "Beity" (meaning "my Home" in arabic) was established after the fall of the dictatoriship in 2011 and aims to servethe goals of equality, freedom and social justice. She was born of the realization that the exclusion and violence are notinevitable or the accident of a personal journey but the result of a system of domination and unequal gender,race and class relations. Those unequal relations require to act in a sustainable manner, putting the overall basis for action the rights and human dignity of women. The association aims to provide adapted services in a housing facility for the women living in the street, mainly victims of domestic violence in order to minimize their exposure to further violence, exclusion and marginalization. The founding group is composed of fifteen people from different backgrounds involved in various capacities in the field of civil, feminist and community action for human rights, equality, freedom and against gender exclusion.

mailing-address.narrative: PO box 30919, 2500 GX The Hague, The Netherlands
